00033 void CLHistProjector::deleteH3() {
00034   if (_ownH3) {
00035     TH3F * h3Own = (TH3F*)_h3;
00036     delete h3Own;

00042 const char * CLHistProjector::axisName(const TAxis * axis) const {
00043   if (axisR() == axis) {
00044     return nameR();
00045   }
00046   if (axisG() == axis) {
00047     return nameG();
00048   }
00049   if (axisD() == axis) {
00050     return nameD();
00051   }
00052   return 0;
00053 }

00055 
00056 // Translate the i# bin numbers into iR, iG, iD bin numbers, given the axes:
00057 void CLHistProjector::translate(const TAxis * axes[3], 
00058                                 int indices[3],
00059                                 int & iR, int & iG, int & iD) const {
00060   for (int j = 0; j < 3; ++j) {
00061     if (axisR() == axes[j]) {iR = indices[j];}
00062     if (axisG() == axes[j]) {iG = indices[j];}
00063     if (axisD() == axes[j]) {iD = indices[j];}
00064   }
00065 }

00068 
00069 // "Project" the 3D hist onto 1D: 
00070 TH1F * CLHistProjector::projOnto(const TAxis * axis) const { 
00071   // make the resulting histogram:
00072   TString name = _h3->GetName() + TString("-") + axisName(axis);
00073 
00074   int nBins = axis->GetNbins();
00075   double lo = axis->GetXmin();
00076   double hi = axis->GetXmax();
00077 
00078   TH1F * result = new TH1F(name, name, nBins, lo, hi);
00079 
00080   // find the other axis:
00081   const TAxis * axis2 = 0;
00082   const TAxis * axis3 = 0;
00083 
00084   if (axisR() == axis) {
00085     axis2 = axisG();
00086     axis3 = axisD();
00087   }
00088   else if (axisG() == axis) {
00089     axis2 = axisD();
00090     axis3 = axisR();
00091   }
00092   else if (axisD() == axis) {
00093     axis2 = axisR();
00094     axis3 = axisG();
00095   }
00096 
00097   // Prepare for use later:
00098   const TAxis * axes[3] = {axis, axis2, axis3};
00099 
00100   // For each bin in the result histogram:
00101   for (int i1 = 1; i1 <= axis->GetNbins(); ++i1) {
00102     result->SetBinContent(i1, 2.0);  // start from ~2 * max value
00103     // loop over bins of the other axes:
00104     for (int i2 = 1; i2 <= axis2->GetNbins(); ++i2) {
00105       for (int i3 = 1; i3 <= axis3->GetNbins(); ++i3) {
00106         // Translate the i# bin numbers into iR, iG, iD bin numbers:
00107         int indices[3] = {i1, i2, i3};
00108         int iR, iG, iD;
00109         translate(axes, indices, iR, iG, iD);
00110 
00111         // and keep the smallest _h3-valued bin:
00112         double h3Value = _h3->GetBinContent(iR, iG, iD);
00113         if (result->GetBinContent(i1) > h3Value) {
00114           result->SetBinContent(i1, h3Value);
00115         }
00116       }
00117     }
00118   }
00119 
00120   return result;
00121 }

00123 
00124 TH2F * CLHistProjector::projOnto(const TAxis * axis1, 
00125                                  const TAxis * axis2) const {
00126   // make the resulting histogram:
00127   TString name = _h3->GetName() + TString("-") + axisName(axis1)
00128     + TString("-") + axisName(axis2);
00129 
00130   int nBins[2] = {axis1->GetNbins(), axis2->GetNbins()};
00131   double lo[2] = {axis1->GetXmin(), axis2->GetXmin()};
00132   double hi[2] = {axis1->GetXmax(), axis2->GetXmax()};
00133 
00134   TH2F * result = new TH2F(name, name, 
00135                            nBins[0], lo[0], hi[0],
00136                            nBins[1], lo[1], hi[1]);
00137 
00138   // find the other axis:
00139   const TAxis * axis3 = axisR();
00140 
00141   if (axisR() == axis1 || axisR() == axis2) {
00142     axis3 = axisG();
00143     if (axisG() == axis1 || axisG() == axis2) {
00144       axis3 = axisD();
00145     }
00146   }
00147 
00148   // Prepare for use later:
00149   const TAxis * axes[3] = {axis1, axis2, axis3};
00150 
00151   // For each bin in the result histogram:
00152   for (int i1 = 1; i1 <= axis1->GetNbins(); ++i1) {
00153     for (int i2 = 1; i2 <= axis2->GetNbins(); ++i2) {
00154       result->SetBinContent(i1, i2, 2.0);  // start from ~2 * max value
00155       // loop over bins of the other axis:
00156       for (int i3 = 1; i3 <= axis3->GetNbins(); ++i3) {
00157         // Translate the i# bin numbers into iR, iG, iD bin numbers:
00158         int indices[3] = {i1, i2, i3};
00159         int iR, iG, iD;
00160         translate(axes, indices, iR, iG, iD);
00161 
00162         // and keep the smallest _h3-valued bin:
00163         double h3Value = _h3->GetBinContent(iR, iG, iD);
00164         if (result->GetBinContent(i1, i2) > h3Value) {
00165           result->SetBinContent(i1, i2, h3Value);
00166         }
00167       }
00168     }
00169   }
00170 
00171   return result;
00172 }

00174 
00175 void CLHistProjector::makeAllProj() {
00176   _hR = projOnto(axisR());
00177   _hG = projOnto(axisG());
00178   _hD = projOnto(axisD());
00179 
00180   _hRG = projOnto(axisR(), axisG());
00181   _hRD = projOnto(axisR(), axisD());
00182   _hGD = projOnto(axisG(), axisD());
00183 }

00186 
00187 void CLHistProjector::combine(const char * files[], 
00188                               int nFiles,
00189                               const char * histName) {
00190   // Combines all the histograms named histName in the files into a single
00191   // histogram and puts it in _h3.
00192   // Note that the histogram for each file has a different range of 
00193   // rB bins, which is taken into account:
00194 
00195   int nBinsRPerHist = 0;
00196   int nBinsR = 0;
00197   int nBinsG = 0;
00198   int nBinsD = 0;
00199 
00200   double loR = 10;  // the R limits have "inverse" initial values 
00201   double hiR = 0;
00202   double loG = -1;  // the other limits have something arbitrary
00203   double hiG = -1;
00204   double loD = -1;
00205   double hiD = -1;
00206 
00207   // Read the files once to determine their limits and nbins.
00208   // The algorithm closes unused files, so as not to hold too much
00209   // stuff in memory when we create the big _h3.
00210   cout << "Reading files to find limits:" << endl;
00211   int f;
00212   for (f = 0; f < nFiles; ++f) {
00213     TFile file(files[f]);   // not a pointer, so lives only in this loop
00214     const TH3F * h3 = (const TH3F*)file.Get(histName);
00215 
00216     if (0 == h3) {
00217       cerr << "File " << files[f] << " contains no object named "
00218            << histName  << ". It does include: " << endl;
00219       file.ls();
00220       cerr << "Skipping this file." << endl;
00221       continue;
00222     }
00223 
00224     const TAxis * rAxis = h3->GetXaxis();
00225     const TAxis * gAxis = h3->GetYaxis();
00226     const TAxis * dAxis = h3->GetZaxis();
00227 
00228     cout << " " << files[f] << ", rB limits= " 
00229          << rAxis->GetXmin() << " -- " << rAxis->GetXmax() << endl;
00230 
00231     // Find the rB limits from the extremes of all histograms:
00232     if (loR > rAxis->GetXmin()) {loR = rAxis->GetXmin();}
00233     if (hiR < rAxis->GetXmax()) {hiR = rAxis->GetXmax();}
00234 
00235     if (0 == f) {
00236       // on the first file, calculate the number of rB bins:
00237       nBinsRPerHist = rAxis->GetNbins();
00238       nBinsR = nBinsRPerHist * nFiles;
00239       nBinsG = gAxis->GetNbins();
00240       nBinsD = dAxis->GetNbins();
00241 
00242       // Also get the delta and gamma histogram limits: 
00243       loG = gAxis->GetXmin();
00244       hiG = gAxis->GetXmax();
00245 
00246       loD = dAxis->GetXmin();
00247       hiD = dAxis->GetXmax();
00248     }
00249     else {
00250       // on subsequent files, just check that the # of bins hasn't changed:
00251       assert(rAxis->GetNbins() == nBinsRPerHist);
00252       assert(gAxis->GetNbins() == nBinsG);
00253       assert(dAxis->GetNbins() == nBinsD);
00254 
00255       // For gamma and delta, also the limits shouldn't change. Not the same
00256       // for rB, whose range is determined from the extremes of all 
00257       // histograms:
00258       assert(gAxis->GetXmin() == loG);
00259       assert(dAxis->GetXmin() == loD);
00260 
00261       assert(gAxis->GetXmax() == hiG);
00262       assert(dAxis->GetXmax() == hiD);
00263     }
00264   }
00265 
00266   cout << "Found nBins: R=" << nBinsR << ", G=" << nBinsG << ", D=" << nBinsD
00267        << endl
00268        << "  low Range:  R=" << loR << ", G=" << loG << ", D=" << loD
00269        << endl
00270        << " high Range:  R=" << hiR << ", G=" << hiG << ", D=" << hiD
00271        << endl;
00272   
00273   // Done getting limits. Create the resulting histogram:
00274   deleteH3();
00275 
00276   TString h3Name = histName;
00277   h3Name += "-sum";
00278 
00279   TH3F * h3new = new TH3F(h3Name, h3Name, 
00280                           nBinsR, loR, hiR,
00281                           nBinsG, loG, hiG,
00282                           nBinsD, loD, hiD);
00283     
00284   // Extract the histograms from the files and fill into h3new:
00285   for (f = 0; f < nFiles; ++f) {
00286     cout << "Adding histogram from " << files[f] << endl;
00287 
00288     TFile file(files[f]);   // not a pointer, so lives only in this loop
00289     const TH3F * h3toAdd = (const TH3F*)file.Get(histName);
00290 
00291     const TAxis * axisR = h3toAdd->GetXaxis();
00292     int nBinsR = axisR->GetNbins();
00293 
00294     const TAxis * axisG = h3toAdd->GetYaxis();
00295     int nBinsG = axisG->GetNbins();
00296 
00297     const TAxis * axisD = h3toAdd->GetZaxis();
00298     int nBinsD = axisD->GetNbins();
00299 
00300     // Loop over all bins in h3toAdd and fill their contents into h3new:
00301     for (int iR = 1; iR <= nBinsR; ++iR) {
00302       double rB = axisR->GetBinCenter(iR);
00303       for (int iG = 1; iG <= nBinsG; ++iG) {
00304         double gamma = axisG->GetBinCenter(iG);
00305         for (int iD = 1; iD <= nBinsD; ++iD) {
00306           double delta = axisD->GetBinCenter(iD);
00307 
00308           int filledBin = h3new->Fill(rB, gamma, delta, 
00309                                       h3toAdd->GetBinContent(iR, iG, iD));
00310 
00311           // Error checking that bin hasn't been filled twice:
00312           if(h3new->GetBinContent(filledBin) 
00313              != h3toAdd->GetBinContent(iR, iG, iD)) {
00314             cout << "h3new's bin " << filledBin << " was already filled. iR="
00315                  << iR << ", iG=" << iG << "iD=" << iD << endl;
00316             assert(0);
00317           }
00318         }
00319       } 
00320     }  // end loop over 3D bins
00321   }  // end loop over files
00322   // Copy the mutable h3New into the const _h3:
00323   _h3 = h3new;
00324   _ownH3 = true;
00325 }

00328 
00329 void CLHistProjector::saveHists(const char * fileName, bool saveH3) const {
00330   TFile file(fileName, "RECREATE");
00331   _hRG->Write();
00332   _hRD->Write();
00333   _hGD->Write();
00334   _hR->Write();
00335   _hG->Write();
00336   _hD->Write();
00337 
00338   if (saveH3) {
00339     _h3->Write();
00340   }
00341 
00342   cout << "Saved histograms to file " << fileName << endl;
00343 }
